intro: Crotalaria cephalotes var. moeroensis, commonly known as the Moeroensis Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant is typically found in grassy areas and disturbed soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it plays a role in nitrogen fixation due to its symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
